dcterms:creator: Y. Song
L. Wei
Q. Yang
J. Wu
L. Xing
Y. Chen
dcterms:description: The EDSSP problem is to designate a time-ordered task execution sequence for electromagnetic detection satellites. The goal is to maximize the detection sequence profit while satisfying various satellite constraints.
dcterms:title: Electromagnetic Detection Satellite Scheduling Problem (EDSSP)

dcterms:creator: Y. Song
L. Xing
Y. Chen
dcterms:description: The MSJOPP problem involves scheduling a series of separable and inseparable observation tasks for multi-satellite resources, determining which satellite will complete each task and the specific execution time.
dcterms:title: Multi-satellite Joint Observation Planning Problem (MSJOPP)

dcterms:creator: J. Berger
E. Giasson
M. Florea
M. Harb
A. Teske
E. Petriu
R. Abielmona
R. Falcon
N. Lo
dcterms:description: A graph-based genetic algorithm is proposed to solve the virtual constellation multi-satellite collection scheduling problem.
dcterms:title: Virtual Constellation Multi-satellite Collection Scheduling Problem

dcterms:creator: X. Chen
G. Reinelt
G. Dai
A. Spitz
dcterms:description: A mixed integer linear programming model is developed for multi-satellite scheduling.
dcterms:title: Multi-satellite Scheduling
